intro: Grewia andramparo subsp. belohensis, commonly known as the Malagasy hibiscus, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by distinctive three-lobed capsules as its fruit. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
